text: A high-definition map (HD map) is a highly accurate map made for self-driving cars. They have things not present on traditional maps. HD maps are accurate at a centimetre level. HD maps are made using different sensors. These sensors include LiDARs, radars, digital cameras and GPS. HD maps can also be made using aerial imagery. High-definition maps can include things like road shape, road marking, traffic signs and barriers. == References == Category:Maps Category:Automotive technologies
title: High-definition map
